subject: Home & DIY
title: Color Psychology in Bedrooms
description: A quick win: understand Color Psychology in Bedrooms.

hook.text: People with blue bedrooms sleep 30 minutes longer on average than those with red or purple bedrooms.

buildup.text: Blue triggers calming responses. Red and orange fire the sympathetic nervous systemâ€”fight or flight.

discovery.text: Specialized retinal cells (not rods or cones) detect blue wavelengths and signal the brain to suppress alertness.

twist.text: Green calms nearly as well as blue. Yellow bedrooms surprise: the brain reads brightness as a wake-up signal.

climax.text: The ideal bedroom palette: muted blues, soft greens, or warm neutrals. Avoid saturated warm tones near the bed.

punchline.text: Your wall color is your first sleep aid.

quiz.question: Why do blue bedrooms promote better sleep?
options: Blue reflects less light at night
